alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 1:01PM PST until December 06 at 3:16AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... South Fork Stillaguamish River Near Jordan Rd. Bridge affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rainfall is mostly ended in the north central Cascades, but residual runoff, possibly with a small addition of lower elevation snow melt has kept the Stillaguamish River rising and close to a record stage. For the North West Region...including Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Stillaguamish River near Jordan Rd. Bridge. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the South Fork Stillaguamish River will cause flooding in Granite Falls downstream to the Blue Spruce area and Jordan Road. A stage of 16 feet corresponds to Phase 3 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Flood stage is 14.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM PST Tuesday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 915 PM PST.
